country.name: Kazakhstan
country.overview: Kazakhstan, a Central Asian country and former Soviet republic, extends from the Caspian Sea in the west to the Altai Mountains at its eastern border with China and Russia. Its largest metropolis, Almaty, is a long-standing trading hub whose landmarks include Ascension Cathedral, a tsarist-era Russian Orthodox church, and the Central State Museum of Kazakhstan, displaying thousands of Kazakh artifacts.

translations.name: សាធារណរដ្ឋកាហ្សាក់ស្ថាន
ကာဇက်စတန်နိုင်ငံ
ประเทศคาซัคสถาน

geography.location_description: Central Asia, northwest of China; a small portion west of the Ural (Zhayyq) River in easternmost Europe
geography.area_note: slightly less than four times the size of Texas
geography.climate: continental, cold winters and hot summers, arid and semiarid
geography.terrain: vast flat steppe extending from the Volga in the west to the Altai Mountains in the east and from the plains of western Siberia in the north to oases and deserts of Central Asia in the south
geography.hazards: earthquakes in the south; mudslides around Almaty
geography.notes: world's largest landlocked country; Russia leases approximately 6,000 sq km of territory enclosing the Baykonur Cosmodrome; in January 2004, Kazakhstan and Russia extended the lease to 2050
